label: Lunar eclipse (partial) — 13 Mar 4 BCE (astronomical year −0003)
notes: GSFC Five Millennium Catalog row −0003‑03‑13 with ΔT=10562 s (TT of greatest eclipse).

label: Lunar eclipse (total) — 14 Apr 32 CE
notes: GSFC 0001–0100 catalog row 0032‑04‑14 with ΔT=10212 s (TT of greatest eclipse).

label: Lunar eclipse (partial) — 3 Apr 33 CE
notes: GSFC 0001–0100 catalog row 0033‑04‑03 with ΔT=10202 s (TT of greatest eclipse).

label: Halley’s Comet — perihelion AD 66 (historical reconstructions)
notes: Perihelion epoch uncertain pre‑837; Holetschek set T≈66 Jan 26.5; Kiang (1972) discusses range (Jan 26.5 to early Feb).

label: SN 1054 (Crab) — first sighting in Chinese records
notes: Exact time-of-day not preserved; provide date only.

label: Total Solar Eclipse — 15 Jun 763 BCE (Bur‑Sagale)
notes: GSFC SE-0762Jun15T.pdf: Greatest Eclipse TD (14:07:32.0) and UT (08:14:01.4).

label: Total Solar Eclipse — 28 May 585 BCE (Thales)
notes: GSFC SE-0584May28T.pdf: Greatest Eclipse TD (19:28:50.3) and UT (14:22:26.4).

label: 1P/Halley — perihelion (date-only) — 5 Oct 12 BCE
notes: Perihelion date per historical reconstructions (uncertainty few days pre‑837); no exact UT.

label: 1P/Halley — perihelion (date-only) — 23 Mar 1066
notes: Perihelion date per historical reconstructions; early apparitions ±days; no exact UT.

label: SN 1006 — first sighting in records — 1 May 1006
notes: Historical sources compile a first-sighting window ~Apr 30/May 1; time unknown — date-only.

label: VAT 4956 — auroral ‘red glow’ observation — 12 Mar 567 BCE
notes: Stephenson (A&G 2004): aurora dated to the night of 12/13 Mar 567 BCE; use 12 Mar as civil anchor.

label: SN 1181 — first sightings (date-only, window early Aug)
notes: Chinese/Japanese records; adopt 1181‑08‑06 (Julian) as canonical day-only; hour unknown.

label: SN 1572 (Tycho) — first report (date-only)
notes: Pre‑1582 region uses Julian; first reports 1572‑11‑11 (Julian).

label: SN 1604 (Kepler) — first report (date-only)
notes: Post‑reform; Gregorian date 1604‑10‑09 used in literature (hour unknown).

label: 1P/Halley — earliest Shiji record (year-only; mid‑year placeholder)
notes: Shiji gives a year; choose 01 Jul as neutral civil anchor for AM mapping (hour unknown).
